curam.util.events.impl
Interface EventFilter

public interface EventFilter

This class defines an interface for filtering events raised by the Curam event service. The event service allows application code to respond to events raised by other parts of the application by implementing an event handler. Event handlers listen for events based on the event class. However some handlers may only be in subset of events of the specified type. An event filter can be implemented to determine which events to forward to the associated event handler and which events to ignore. See EventHandler for a more detailed description of an event handler. Every filter must also be registered with the event service before it can be used.

An event is passed as the parameter to the accept method. See EventService for a more detailed description of an event.

Event filter processing is implementation-specific but there are a few issues with the Curam event filtering mechanism which may influence the implementation:

  • Every event filter implementation is explicitly associated with an event class. The scope of the event class type can be as specialized or generalized as the implementation requires. There are no restrictions on the number of filters and/or event class types. No default event filter is provided with the event service.

    Method Summary
     boolean accept(Event event)
              An implementation of this method is used to determine if the associated event handler should be invoked for this event.
     

    Method Detail

    accept

    boolean accept(Event event)
               throws AppException,
                      InformationalException
    An implementation of this method is used to determine if the associated event handler should be invoked for this event.

    Parameters:
    event - an event the filter is to process.
    Returns:
    true if the corresponding event handler should be invoked for this event, otherwise false.
    Throws:
    AppException - exceptions that may occur while filtering an event.
    InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
